|Title=Know the definition of palpitations
|Description=description and syndromic field

|Contributors=Arnaud Bisson
|Order=1}}
Palpitations'' are a subjective disorder corresponding to :

*a sensation of ''abnormal perception of heartbeats'', normal or abnormal, described as ''the heart struggling'' in the chest;
*a sensation that the heart is beating too hard (hyperkinetic palpitation), or too fast or irregularly (rhythmic palpitation, ''tachycardia'')

They can be felt laterocervically along the carotid arteries.

question.title: Palpitations'' are a subjective disorder corresponding to :
question.description: What is the definition of palpitations?

option_a.title: A sensation of normal heartbeats with a feeling of anxiety

option_b.title: A sensation that the heart is beating too hard (hyperkinetic palpitation), or too fast or irregularly (rhythmic palpitation, ''tachycardia'')

option_c.title: A sensation that the heart is not beating at all
option_c.description: A possible but incorrect interpretation of palpitations

option_d.title: A sensation that the heart is beating too slow (bradycardia)

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: The letter indicating the correct option
